TestDescription.name: Zend framework configuration file information disclosure
TestDescription.Description: The Zend Framework uses a file named [bold]application.ini[/bold] where various sensitive data is stored (such as database credentials). This file is located in the [bold]/application/configs[/bold] directory. Normally this file is not dirrectly accessible but some developers improperly set the application root and make this file acessible from the web.
TestDescription.Recommendation:
Restrict access to this file or set your document_root to myapp/public and not myapp..
To restrict access to the file, create a .htaccess file in the directory "/application/configs" that contains the following line: [code][pre] deny from all [/code] [/pre]
